results.title: Anansi the spider: a tale from the Ashanti
results.creator_credit: Gerald McDermott and Gerald McDermott Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “African folklore”.
Anansi is a folk hero of the Ashanti people of Ghana and is a spider with human qualities. In this tale he falls into a river and is swallowed by a fish. After his rescue another accident befalls him. Rescued again, Anansi wishes to reward his son who has helped him with the aid of a beautiful white globe. Nyame, the One god, resolves the dilemma for him by setting the globe in the sky: it is the moon. Animation by Vincent Bell and narrated by Athmani Magoma. Animation inspired by the sophisticated geometric forms of the Ashanti.

results.title: Ananse's farm
results.creator_credit: John Ossei, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A fable from Ghana, animated on film by a young African film-maker studying with the National Film Board. Ananse is a spider with a heart full of concern over the enmity existing between his friends. Instead of mediating in a straightforward way, he devises a scheme using a little deception to bring his friends to amicable terms. The moral of this folktale from Ghana is that employing the wrong means to an end brings undesired consequences, no matter how right the motive.

results.title: Analysis by mass: an introduction to the mass spectrometer
results.creator_credit: Brian Kaufman, Michael Clarke and Associated Electrical Industries Film Unit
results.brief_description: Structure of atom and nucleus; definition of isotopes; principle of the mass spectograph, explained by a model in which balls of different masses are deflected by different amounts in a constant magnetic field. Construction of a mass spectrometer. Uses of mass spectrometry: to identify molecules, determine molecular structure, measure impurities, analyse gases in breath, radioactive dating of rocks.

results.title: Amy is a tiger
results.creator_credit: Keith Hall and Cameracraft Film Productions
results.brief_description: A promotional film for industrial development in Queensland. A Canadian, visiting Queensland to report on business prospects and industrialization, charters Amy, an elderly Tiger Moth, to take him to the industrially important areas of the State.

results.title: Amy
results.creator_credit: Phil Noyce, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Why can’t they be like we were?”.
Amy is a 16 year-old aboriginal girl from the country now living in Sydney. She faces many problems at school, in getting a job, and in the community because of her colour. Photography by Dean Semler.

results.title: Amphibians
results.brief_description: Presents the life cycles, habits and general characteristics of amphibians - frogs, toads, and salamanders. Points out characteristics shared by these three creatures and how they differ. Explains the changes which occur during metamorphosis; feeding habits; hibernation; cold-bloodedness, skin and skeletal characteristics. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Among the living
results.creator_credit: Osborn Segerberg and United Nations Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man builds - man destroys”.
Raises the question of whether there is such a thing as an “optimum” world population, while looking closely at the town of Huntington on Long Island, one of the many satellite communities surrounding New York City. Presents the views on population of such noted authorities as Paul Ehrlich, Barry Commoner, Philip Hauser, Alan Guttmacher and Lincoln Day. Hosted by Don Pringle.

results.title: Among fish
results.creator_credit: Kenneth McCready, Rene Jodoin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A demonstration, for junior science classes, of what fish are, how they live, breathe, swim and, more remarkable, how they float up or down by manipulating their air bladder. The fish shown in the film are of the kind native to Canada’s lakes and streams, but others, of the tropical variety, are observed in the miniature marine world of a classroom aquarium. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Amoeba
results.brief_description: This one-celled organism has been photographed as a solid object and not, as diagrammatic represent- ations suggest, a flat object in one plane. The production of pseudopods is shown - the amoeba pursuing and capturing its prey and ingesting living organisms

results.title: America's traffic problem
results.brief_description: Presents the national traffic problem created by an automotive age, and shows some of the solutions which have been put into effect to alleviate the situation. Far-sighted educators know that a partial solution to the traffic dilemma is the training of young people in good driving techniques. No other credits available.
